key_points: Donald John Trump was born in Queens, New York, on June 14, 1946.
He took over his father's real estate company in 1971, renaming it the Trump Organization.
Trump was elected as the 45th President of the United States in 2016.
His presidency focused on tax reform, deregulation, trade protectionism, and immigration control.
The Trump administration moved the U.S. Embassy in Israel to Jerusalem and engaged in historic diplomacy with North Korea.
Trump faced impeachment in 2019 over allegations of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress but was acquitted by the Senate in 2020.
His handling of the COVID-19 pandemic was widely criticized; over 400,000 Americans died from the virus by the end of his term.
Trump lost the 2020 Presidential election to Joe Biden but made unsubstantiated claims of voter fraud.
The Capitol riot on January 6, 2021, led to Trump's second impeachment by the House on charges of incitement of insurrection.
Donald Trump is the only president in American history to be impeached twice by Congress.
